channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Frederick Wiseman, who captured the weirdness and wonder of everyday life, dies at 96
item.description: The prolific, pioneering filmmaker made dozens of documentaries and chronicled the inner workings of institutions. His 1967 film, Titicut Follies, revealed appalling conditions at a prison facility.
item.content:encoded:
The prolific, pioneering filmmaker made dozens of documentaries and chronicled the inner workings of institutions. His 1967 film, Titicut Follies, revealed appalling conditions at a prison facility.

(Image credit: Larry Busacca)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Two U.S. moms in their 40s rocketed to gold and bronze in Olympic bobsled showdown
item.description: American sliders Elana Meyers Taylor, 41, and Kaillie Humphreys, 40, secure gold and bronze medals. Meyers-Taylor built on her record as the Black athlete with the most Winter Olympics medals.
item.content:encoded:
American sliders Elana Meyers Taylor, 41, and Kaillie Humphreys, 40, secure gold and bronze medals. Meyers-Taylor built on her record as the Black athlete with the most Winter Olympics medals.

(Image credit: Aijaz Rahi)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: The U.S. women's hockey team is dominating the Olympics. Now they will play for gold
item.description: The Americans, whose captain Hilary Knight is leading a generation of thrilling young talent, are undefeated through six games at the Olympics — and they're outscoring their opponents 31 to 1.
item.content:encoded:
The Americans, whose captain Hilary Knight is leading a generation of thrilling young talent, are undefeated through six games at the Olympics — and they're outscoring their opponents 31 to 1.

(Image credit: Alexander Nemenov)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: A curling scandal rocks Olympic ice
item.description: Allegations of cheating and swearing on the curling ice have rocked the sport after the Swedes accused the Canadians of "double touching" in a match. What happened then, and what's happened since?
item.content:encoded:
Allegations of cheating and swearing on the curling ice have rocked the sport after the Swedes accused the Canadians of "double touching" in a match. What happened then, and what's happened since?

(Image credit: Misper Apawu)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: The U.S. ready to make up, Europe ready to break up in Munich
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio tried to reassure Europe at the Munich Security Conference, but European leaders are skeptical.
item.content:encoded:
Secretary of State Marco Rubio tried to reassure Europe at the Munich Security Conference, but European leaders are skeptical.

(Image credit: Johannes Simon)
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: Actor Robert Duvall has died — he brought a compassionate center to edgy hard roles
item.description: Duvall appeared in over 90 films over the course of his career, imbuing stock Hollywood types — cowboys, cops, soldiers — with a nuanced sense of vulnerability.
item.content:encoded:
Duvall appeared in over 90 films over the course of his career, imbuing stock Hollywood types — cowboys, cops, soldiers — with a nuanced sense of vulnerability.

(Image credit: Mark Mainz)
item.dc:creator: Glen Weldon

item.title: Italy's athletes shine at the Milan Cortina Olympics
item.description: Call it homefield advantage, call it national pride. Italy's athletes are shining in the Winter Olympics underway in Milan and the Alps.
item.content:encoded:
Call it homefield advantage, call it national pride. Italy's athletes are shining in the Winter Olympics underway in Milan and the Alps.

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin/AP)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Primary care is in trouble. Doctors are banding together to increase market power
item.description: As costs increase, primary care practices are joining forces in Independent Physician Associations. The goal is to leverage better insurance contracts, while ensuring doctors still call the shots.
item.content:encoded:
As costs increase, primary care practices are joining forces in Independent Physician Associations. The goal is to leverage better insurance contracts, while ensuring doctors still call the shots.

(Image credit: Karen Brown)
item.dc:creator: Karen Brown

item.title: DHS shuts down after a funding lapse. And, why athletes get the 'yips' at the Olympics
item.description: Congress is out on recess as a partial shutdown at the Department of Homeland Security is underway. And, why some superstar athletes have been getting the "yips" at the Winter Olympics in Italy.
item.content:encoded:
Congress is out on recess as a partial shutdown at the Department of Homeland Security is underway. And, why some superstar athletes have been getting the "yips" at the Winter Olympics in Italy.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: One Olympic sport doesn't allow women. These Games could determine its future
item.description: Nordic combined is the only Olympic sport that doesn't allow women to compete, despite athletes' efforts to change that. They say their odds for 2030 hinge on people watching men's events this week.
item.content:encoded:
Nordic combined is the only Olympic sport that doesn't allow women to compete, despite athletes' efforts to change that. They say their odds for 2030 hinge on people watching men's events this week.

(Image credit: Barbara Gindl)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman
